Really Secure Algorithm
========
**Category**: crypto  **Points**: 30

Challenge Description
------------
We were given the following numbers
```
p = 8337989838551614633430029371803892077156162494012474856684174381868510024755832450406936717727195184311114937042673575494843631977970586746618123352329889
q = 7755060911995462151580541927524289685569492828780752345560845093073545403776129013139174889414744570087561926915046519199304042166351530778365529171009493
e = 65537
c = 

```

In RSA, given p, q and e, we can calculate d such that the private key can be deduced to decrypt the cipher text c

Solution
-----------------

ref: https://github.com/findneo/RSA-ATTACK/blob/master/rsattack/rsattack.py

```
import gmpy2
import binascii

p = 8337989838551614633430029371803892077156162494012474856684174381868510024755832450406936717727195184311114937042673575494843631977970586746618123352329889
q = 7755060911995462151580541927524289685569492828780752345560845093073545403776129013139174889414744570087561926915046519199304042166351530778365529171009493
e = 65537
c = 
n = p*q

d=gmpy2.invert(e,(p-1)*(q-1))

key = pow(c, d, n)
flag = binascii.unhexlify(hex(int(key))[2:-1])
print flag

```

flag: `actf{really_securent_algorithm}`
